body_html:
@lukemurray what directory are you in when running this? This folder /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld/caffe2_1528124553008/_test_env_placehold..... is only a temporary build folder created by conda-build. You should never try to run anything under the /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld folder and there should be no environment variables or paths pointing to any folder under /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld.

If those are the only two locations where libcaffe2.dylib exists on your machine, then Caffe2 was never actually installed and there was some error during the make or install process. Does "conda list caffe2" show any results? It looks like a Caffe2 package was created, so maybe try "conda install caffe2 --use-local"

body:
@lukemurray what directory are you in when running this? This folder /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld/caffe2_1528124553008/_test_env_placehold..... is only a temporary build folder created by conda-build. You should never try to run anything under the /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld folder and there should be no environment variables or paths pointing to any folder under /Users/me/anaconda3/conda-bld.

If those are the only two locations where libcaffe2.dylib exists on your machine, then Caffe2 was never actually installed and there was some error during the make or install process. Does "conda list caffe2" show any results? It looks like a Caffe2 package was created, so maybe try "conda install caffe2 --use-local"
